review: This device requires Access Ports to be disabled on your home router and uPnP to be enabled.  Don't know about Access Ports but enabling uPnP can be a security risk.  I am not willing to configure my router to meet these specs.  I returned the ChromeCast.

review: I have been owning this toy for quite some time (probably 1 year), so it is time to give it some of my thoughts.I currently have 3 of these devices. One for my living room, one for my bedroom and one more my father's bedroompros:1. very easy to set up2. very easy to broadcast anything from youtube3. Quality is great as it is HDMI streaming4. Even support vob file (need to install additional chrome extension)5. Easy to use as long as you are on the same networkcons:1. need to be powered up via a microUSB. I wish it could power up using the HDMI somehow....just somethought to reduce less cable tangled behind my TV.2. lagging when network is kinda hịt3. look kinda chubby4. to broadcast, we need Google Chrome browser. Since Windows phone does not have Google Chrome, can't use Windows phone to broadcast. Need workaround to do so.
